Key Match Events: Francois Kamano was given a red card in the first half for a stamp on Frank Magri.
Guinea played the entire second half with 10 men after Kamano's red card.
Cameroon equalized in the second half through Frank Magri's towering header.
Karl Toko Ekambi had a chance to make it 2-1 for Cameroon but was denied by a good save from Ibrahim Kone.
Cameroon struggled to create chances in the second half despite having a man advantage.
Guinea's defense held strong to earn a draw despite being down to 10 men.
Pre-Game Insights: Cameroon was without key striker Vincent Aboubakar due to injury.
Guinea was missing Naby Keita from the starting lineup, but he was on the bench.
Cameroon's coach Rigobert Song said that the absence of Aboubakar was a loss, but the other players were ready.
Song also mentioned that the door was always open for Andre Onana, and he was satisfied that the goalkeeper was reunited with the team.
Post-Match Reflections: Cameroon's coach Rigobert Song was likely disappointed with the draw, given that they had a man advantage for most of the game.
Guinea's players and staff were likely relieved with the draw, especially considering they had to play the second half with 10 men.
The draw means that Cameroon and Guinea are level in second place in Group C, behind Senegal.
Cameroon will need to regroup and come up with a better strategy to win their next game.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played in hot conditions, with both teams struggling to create chances in the second half.
The Guinea defense was solid, and they managed to hold off Cameroon's attacks despite being down to 10 men.
Cameroon's players were frustrated with the draw, but they will need to move on and focus on their next game.
The match was an important one for both teams, as they fought for a spot in the knockout stage of the tournament.
Others: The match was played in Yamoussoukro, and the attendance was not full.
Cameroon's goalkeeper Fabrice Ondoa is the cousin of Andre Onana, who did not start the game due to a late arrival.
Guinea's striker Mohamed Bayo scored the opening goal for his team in the 11th minute.
